reviews.text: Stunning location, good basic accommodation, spacious rooms, and wonderful food, all combine to make this a holiday destination to remember.
reviews.title: Stunning view, excellent service, good food, reasonable prices, a gem.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The icing on the cake is the value for money and the friendliness of the owners, which is second to none. A real find, we will be back.
reviews.title: Extremely helpful, relaxed place

reviews.text: We visited Malta to attend a cousins wedding in May this year. We wanted to stay out of the way of the tourist-hoards that occupy much of the island, so we deliberately picked Marsaxlokk. This made choosing accommodation easy as Duncan's guest House was the only accommodation we could find in the village. That said, we were really glad we made the decisions we did. Yes it meant that we had to take a bit longer on the dinky buses to get anywhere, and yes it meant that we had a view of the industrial harbor (not that bad actually - quite pretty at night!) but Marsaxlokk is a really chilled out pretty village. It has a tourist market during the day but when that is over the place is peaceful and occupied by locals. We ended up staying in a flat arranged for us by Michael who works at (and may be related to) Duncan's Guest House.
reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant. Well worth the money and michael so helpful
Loved it here!
reviews.text: The flat was hugely spacious and entirely new (other flats in the building were still being built), we had a little balcony that looked out over the sea and more bedrooms than we could ever need. I got the impression Michael had a few options up his sleeve if we decided we didn't like the accommodation he provided. He also helped us with a taxi when we wanted to get to the wedding, and helped us find shops and helped us figure out the buses. In the end we felt more like one of the locals and had a really lovely five day break. Even if you don't decide to stay at Duncan's Guest House, or indeed in Marsaxlokk I would highly recommend avoiding the crowds of St Julians and the like. Malta is really beautiful and it's very easy to get around - but I got the impression that if you made the wrong decisions you'd have a very different, disappointing holiday.

Just got back from malta. Michael and the family couldnt do more for you. Excellant food good value. Would certainly recommend it to anyone and everyone. Hope to go back again. My kids thoroughly enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Still a well run and friendly guest house in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just spent 4 nights at Duncan's having just been on Gozo for 10 days. Although Gozo is billed as the quiet option for Malta, Marsaxlokk is even more laid back, whilst being in driving distance of Mdina, Valletta and other busy highlights (25 mins.).
reviews.title: Duncan's for the Authentic Malta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms here are spacious, clean and bright while the service is excellent. The staff are very friendly and have plenty of time to chat with customers. Substantial breakfasts are included, either English or continental.
reviews.title: Outstanding service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While the harbour of Marsaxlokk is scenic, the broader horizon is industrial, but scenic swimming spots are not far away. Some temples are also close (Hagar Qim). Currently, re-paving of the promenade is underway and should be complete by the autumn. Marsalxlokk is an excellent base for those who are driving.
reviews.title: Nice but loud and airless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Incidentally, driving is reasonably easy on Malta in spite of the warning of chaos found in some guide books. Signage is quiet good, but satnav makes the job a lot easier. While road surfaces are rough, who cares in a rental car? Some streets are quite narrow and many are one way, but nobody seems to mind too much if you go up the wrong way!
reviews.title: REALLY TRIED TO MAKE OUR HOLIDAY SPECIAL
Great place but lack of free WiFi is a downer.
reviews.text: Maltese people are quite friendly to speak to and most speak English, which is the second language here. Prices are reasonable but not cheap, per se. Well worth a week's stay but not in July or August where the temperatures are well into the thirties Celcius.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are just back from 15 nights at Duncan's in Marsaxlokk and must confess to missing wakening up in room 1 and looking out over the harbour from our balconies, there are 2 balconies in this room.
reviews.title: Excellent, our new home in Malta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As arranged we were picked up at the airport and taken the short 10 minute journey down to Marsaxlokk and our accommodation at Duncan's where we had a warm greeting from Michael and David, our room wasn't quite ready (which wasn't a problem) so we left our bags and went out for a bit of basic shopping, milk etc.
reviews.title: A wonderful friendly place

reviews.text: By the time we got back our room was ready and we were able to get settled in, the room has plenty of drawer and hanging space with a large 3 door wardrobe and 2 bedside cabinets and a chest of drawers.
reviews.title: Top place..Top apartment..Top hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a small but adequate kitchen area with sink and fridge, cutlery and crockery is supplied as is a fridge, toaster, also a kettle with tea and coffee supplied, there is also a small table and 2 chairs for eating at should you wish and a TV with some satellite channels and a DVD player.
reviews.title: Ideally situated, Perfect Host, and everything we could have needed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to heat any food there is a small cooker with 2 rings and an oven in the corridor that you can lift in to the room, however there are no pots/pans but you can heat food such as
reviews.title: A great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly good food helpful and true Malta in an unspoilt part of the island.Basic accommodation great position. Loved our visit.
reviews.title: great hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights at the Duncan's. The room was very good and wide. There are more tools to find in there as you can find in a hotel or so. Michael but also his brothers are very nice and friendly people.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfasts were very good. Television on the room is an LCD with a lot of good channels. There is also wireless internet, my opinion a big plus.
reviews.title: An exceptional opportunity

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited Malta during a week and stayed at several hotels, guesthouses,... The Duncans guesthouse is far the best of them.
reviews.title: Value for Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recommend this hardly.
reviews.title: "THE" PLACE TO STAY IN MARSAXLOKK
